vulnerability.name: CVE-2023-27482
vulnerability.description: Authentication bypass in Home Assistant Supervisor API. This CVE affects homeassistant-supervisor, NOT the general-purpose supervisord process manager (Alpine package: supervisor) used in these images.

statements.impact_statement: These images use the supervisord process manager (supervisord.org), not Home Assistant Supervisor. The Alpine 'supervisor' APK package is an entirely different project from 'homeassistant-supervisor'. Zero Home Assistant code exists in these images.

vulnerability.name: CVE-2025-60876
vulnerability.description: BusyBox wget through 1.37.0 accepts raw CR/LF and C0 control bytes in HTTP request-target, allowing request line splitting and header injection via crafted URLs.

statements.impact_statement: The BusyBox wget applet is never invoked in these images. The base image installs the standalone wget package (APK: wget), which shadows the BusyBox applet in PATH. No entrypoint script, build step, or runtime process in any image layer uses wget â€” all HTTP operations use curl. The BusyBox binary cannot be removed as it is Alpine's coreutils provider, but the vulnerable wget applet within it is unreachable.
